definition: price competition/bid (in an auction)/to compete on price/to bid against sb

sentences.english: Listing period of adjustment may be based on competitive bids were increased price range.
sentences.chinese: 掛牌期間可根據競買人競價情況調整增價幅度。

sentences.english: At auction the buyer bid and bought the wool for his mill.
sentences.chinese: 拍賣會上，買主競價，爲自己的工廠購置羊毛。

sentences.english: The source that says contest price rank is extremely evil is not beyond the mark .
sentences.chinese: 說競價排名是萬惡之源一點都不過分。

sentences.english: Real-time bidding makes it easy to aim ads at susceptible eyeballs.
sentences.chinese: 實時競價可以容易地抓住敏感的眼球。

sentences.english: Second, the protection mechanism for the PPC.
sentences.chinese: 對於競價排名的保護機制。

sentences.english: White Knight, a friendly party in a takeover bid.
sentences.chinese: 白色騎士，收購競價中友好的一方。

sentences.english: But the growth of real-time bidding may prove highly disruptive.
sentences.chinese: 但也許實時競價的增長會極具破壞性。

sentences.english: The participants were told the retail value of the mug before bidding began.
sentences.chinese: 競價之前，參與者被告知了這隻杯子的零售價。

sentences.english: The bidding process will be managed by Morgan Stanley.
sentences.chinese: 該競價過程將由摩根斯坦利公司管理。

sentences.english: We may be subject to patent infringement claims with respect to our P4P platform.
sentences.chinese: 我們由於競價平臺受到專利侵權訴訟。

sentences.english: Regulators may yet stymie the growth of real-time bidding.
sentences.chinese: 管制者或許會對實時競價系統的發展進行阻撓。

sentences.english: Contest price ranks the profit pattern that is Baidu, to this, this give no cause for more criticism.
sentences.chinese: 競價排名是百度的盈利模式，對此，本無可厚非。

sentences.english: During the Clinton years, remember there was a controversy donors?
sentences.chinese: 克林頓當政期間，有個競價捐款記得吧？

sentences.english: You throw out little slips of paper  and they take turns going back and forth.
sentences.chinese: 你如果將競價寫在紙上，他們會來來回回地傳閱。

definition: lit. to hang up a plate/to open up for business/listed (on stock market)
